meanings.sent1: The students were interconverting ideas during the group discussion.
meanings.sent2: The currency can be interconverted at the exchange counter.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were interconverting jokes to make each other laugh.
meanings.sent4: In the magical world of the story, the characters could interconvert their powers.

meanings.definition: To change from one form or state to another.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar was interconverting into a butterfly inside the cocoon.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to interconvert their office space into a creative hub.
meanings.sent3: The weather was interconverting between sunny and rainy every few hours.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions seemed to interconvert rapidly from joy to sadness.
meanings.sent5: The artist was interconverting colors on the canvas to create a beautiful painting.
